intro: Menkea hispidula, commonly known as the hairy menkea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink.
